title: "Grok For Government": Pentagon Signs Deal With Musk's xAI
content: Elon Musk's xAI, which features a large language model that has spewed Hitler-supporting rhetoric and antisemitic tropes, said Monday it has signed a deal to provide its services to the US Department of Defense.

title: Deliberate Or Mechanical Flaw? Pilots vs Pilot Over Air India Crash Report
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's preliminary report on its probe into the Air India crash on June 12, in which 260 people were killed, has stirred speculations and debates on two fronts.

title: Ukraine's Zelensky Proposes New PM, Defence Minister In Major Reshuffle
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday proposed a new prime minister and defence minister, part of a major cabinet reshuffle he said would "renew" government more than three years into Russia's invasion.

title: AAP Vs BJP After Bishnoi Gang Claims Responsibility For Abohar Murder
content: Punjab's ruling Aam Aadmi Party and the opposition BJP are at loggerheads over the law and order situation, with gangsters like Lawrence Bishnoi and Jaggu Bhagwanpuria operating with impunity in the state.

title: Army Conducts 'Prachand Shakti'  Exercise In UP, Showcases Changing Warfare Dynamics
content: In a major step towards battlefield modernisation, the Ram Division of the India Army conducted a high-impact demonstration titled 'Prachand Shakti' at the Kharga Corps Field Training Area, in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Monday.

title: UK Aristocrat, Her Convicted Rapist Partner Found Guilty Over Newborn's Death
content: A jury on Monday found a British woman from an aristocratic family and her convicted rapist partner guilty of manslaughter after their newborn daughter died while they were living off-grid in freezing temperatures.

title: From Monsoon Session, A Hi-Tech Attendance System For Lok Sabha MPs
content: Members of the Lok Sabha will now be able to mark attendance at their seats in the House, addressing a very old complaint, sources have said.

title: Negligence Case Against Film Director After Stuntman Killed In Car Crash
content: A day after the death of renowned stuntman SM Raju during a car-toppling stunt sequence on a Tamil film set, a negligence case has been filed against director Pa Ranjith and three others.

title: 100 Atal Canteens To Open In Delhi, Launch Likely On PM Modi's Birthday
content: The Delhi government is planning to launch 100 Atal Canteens across the national capital, with the inauguration expected to take place on September 17 - to mark Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday, government sources told NDTV.

title: Pak-Based Terrorist's House Seized In Jammu And Kashmir's Kupwara
content: As a part of an ongoing crackdown on terrorist infrastructure, property of a Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist was seized in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara on Wednesday, the police said.

title: Tripura Flash Floods: Over 250 Families Displaced, Schools Shut
content: Over 250 families have been rendered homeless due to flash floods triggered by incessant rainfall in South Tripura on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Cuts Approval Time From 120 Days To 20 For Green Industries
content: The Delhi Government has slashed the approval time for Consent to Operate (CTO) from 120 days to just 20 days for Green Category industries.

title: "PM Modi Built Ram Mandir, Brought 5G To India": Amit Shah
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi built the Ram Temple in Ayodhya and also brought 5G, said Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday, underlining the government's focus on both heritage and progress.

title: Decomposed Body Of 46-Year-Old Man Found At His Residence In Delhi: Cops
content: Thedecomposedbodyofa46-year-oldmanwasfoundinsidehishouseincentralDelhi's Turkman Gate area, a policeofficial said on Monday.

title: 'Influencer' vs 'Influencer' Over Social Media Post On Delhi Road
content: A social media war stretched to the streets of Delhi today. A man was seen lying in the middle of a road and being brutally thrashed by a group of men in a video that has gone viral.

title: Robert Vadra Questioned For 5 Hours By Probe Agency In Laundering Case
content: Businessman Robert Vadra, husband of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, was questioned for about five hours by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at their central Delhi office in a money laundering probe linked to two property deals in London.

title: "Mumbai Blasts Could've Been Averted If...": Ujjwal Nikam On Sanjay Dutt
content: The government's key lawyer Ujjwal Nikam, who is now stepping into politics with a seat in Rajya Sabha after a recommendation from the President of India Droupadi Murmu, took a relook at his career in law today in an exclusive interview with NDTV.

title: Delhi Launches Tourism Fellowship, To Offer Rs 50,000 Monthly
content: The Delhi government launched the Tourism and Heritage Fellowship Program, which aims at preserving and promoting the national capital's historical and cultural heritage, and strengthening the grassroots community to encourage tourism.

title: Indian Team In US, Trade Talks To Begin Tomorrow: Report
content: An Indian commerce ministry team has reached Washington for another round of talks from Monday on the proposed bilateral trade agreement (BTA), an official said.

content: The slapgate over dal in Maharashtra apparently has drawn strong response from Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, who warned his party leaders that they should consider themselves "workers" first and foremost, keep a firm control on their tempers a

content: Points out that while there were 8.70 lakh connections in 2019, the number fell to 4.50 lakh during the YSRCP regime

content: The project under the â€˜Nomad Sikkimâ€™ initiative aims to transform strategic locations in the Himalayan State into year-round hubs for digital professionals

content: The Union Rural Development Ministry issues orders for four-layers of analog verification from gram panchayat level up to State level. A Ministry note cites uploading of â€˜irrelevant or unrelated photographsâ€™ and â€˜mismatchâ€™ in count among other issues in the present system

title: It's MLB Home Run Derby Day! Predictions and more
content: Ready to watch stars swing for the fences? We have your one-stop shop for the most power-packed day of the baseball year. Watch the Home Run Derby at 8 p.m. ET on ESPN and ESPN2.

title: Sources: Jets WR Wilson lands $130M extension
content: The Jets and wide receiver Garrett Wilson reached agreement on a four-year, $130 million contract extension that includes $90 million guaranteed, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Sirianni rips narrative that Eagles carried Hurts
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni offered a pointed response to the notion that quarterback Jalen Hurts was along for the ride during Philadelphia's Super Bowl run last season, calling it "bulls---."

title: Sources: 49ers' Jennings wants new deal or trade
content: 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings, who is scheduled to make $7.5 million in the final year of his deal, wants a new contract or a trade, sources told ESPN.

title: Sankey: SEC, Big Ten have 'different view' of CFP
content: SEC commissioner Greg Sankey says his league and the Big Ten have a "different view" on the College Football Playoff format, which could lead to the possibility that it remains a 12-team format in 2026.

title: M's Raleigh commits to Team USA for 2026 WBC
content: Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, who has an AL-record 38 homers before the All-Star Game, has committed to the 2026 World Baseball Classic for the United States.

title: Bridgewater suspended from HS coaching job
content: Teddy Bridgewater has been suspended from his position as a high school football coach in Miami for allegedly providing impermissible benefits.

title: Wembanyama cleared to return from blood clot
content: Victor Wembanyama announced he has recovered from the deep vein thrombosis in his right shoulder, telling L'Ã‰quipe, "I'm officially cleared to return."

title: Rory ditches sleep for Open practice at home
content: Fresh off the Scottish Open, Rory McIlroy ditched sleep for an early practice for The Open Championship.

title: ðŸ‘€ Snoop Dogg helps Swansea troll Wrexham
content: Not to be outdone by Wrexham's Hollywood glamour, Swansea City enlisted Snoop Dogg to unveil their new jersey and take a shot at their Welsh rivals.

content: Can Scottie Scheffler add to his major total? Is Jon Rahm headed toward big things at Royal Portrush? We break down the top 25 players who can win the 2025 Open Championship.

content: Odds for next four golf majors: 2025 Open Championship, 2026 Masters, PGA Championship and U.S. Open.

content: Where do Paige Bueckers, Caitlin Clark and A'ja Wilson land? Our midseason rankings have a new No. 1 and seven new players.

content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: Club World Cup takeaways: Rating the tournament, best moment, surprise teams, more
content: The 2025 FIFA Club World Cup is over, with Chelsea crowned champions. Time to let our reporters who covered the competition chime in with their final thoughts on the good, bad and ugly.

title: The New Orleans football camp that's keeping the memory of Super Bowl hero Jacoby Jones alive
content: A year after Jones' death, former Ravens teammates Torrey Smith, Bryan Hall and Ray Rice are among those helping Emily London-Jones carry on Jones' mission.

title: Unstoppable Messi has Miami back on top
content: Lionel Messi registered his fifth straight multigoal game, propelling Miami to the top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: Club World Cup triumph shows Chelsea can win the Premier League
content: Chelsea have been crowned world champions -- but only when they end their Premier League title drought will the Blues be able to say they are back where they expect to be.

title: Fantasy football beginner's guide to salary cap drafts
content: Eric Karabell's provides an introduction to the ins and outs of salary cap drafts for fantasy football.

title: Reports: Spanish agencies want Yamal party probe
content: Spain's Ministry for Social Rights has requested an investigation into possible breaches of disability laws at Barcelona star Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday party, according to EFE.

title: Sources: Newcastle on verge of â‚¬80m Ekitike deal
content: Newcastle are on the verge of finalising an â‚¬80 million ($93.3m) deal for Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike, sources have told ESPN.

title: Chelsea's Colwill: CWC will be bigger than UCL
content: Chelsea's Levi Colwill has said his side is ready to win the Premier League and Champions League after they won the Club World Cup.

title: Euro 2025 group games draw record crowds
content: The group stage of the Women's European Championship which finished on Sunday had record-breaking attendances with close to half a million fans attending games.

title: PSG coach plays down Pedro push: Can't happen
content: Luis Enrique said he was trying to separate players during a post-match brawl at the end of Paris Saint-Germain's Club World Cup final defeat against Chelsea after footage appeared to show the him pushing Joao Pedro to the ground.

title: Modric joins Milan after 13 seasons at Madrid
content: At age 39, Luka Modric is going to try and help restore seven-time European champion AC Milan to glory after one of the most disappointing Rossoneri seasons in recent memory.

title: Golden Ball winner Palmer happy to silence critics
content: Cole Palmer spoke of taking satisfaction at proving doubters wrong after Chelsea's 3-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup final on Aunday.

title: Euro 2025 group stage talking points: Best team, best player, predictions, more
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship is into the knockout stage. But what stood out for our reporters?

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern turn to Trossard after Luis Diaz move stalls
content: Bayern Munich will turn to Arsenal forward Leandro Trossard if a move for Liverpool's Luis DÃ­az falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Balasore sexual harassment case: Student succumbs to injuries after self-immolation
content: A 20-year-old student from FM Autonomous College, Balasore, tragically died after self-immolating due to alleged sexual harassment by a faculty member. Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi expressed deep sorrow and assured strict punishment for those guilty. The student's action followed protests against the college's inaction regarding her complaints.

title: Pakistan's political, military brass ordered hit at Pahalgam: Officials
content: Sources indicate the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in 26 civilian deaths, was orchestrated by Pakistan's ISI and Lashkar-e-Taiba, with approval from Pakistani political and military leaders. The operation, executed solely by Pakistani terrorists, was led by Sulaiman, a suspected former Pakistani special forces commando.

title: Houthi factor: Why govt said it can't do much to save Nimisha Priya's execution in Yemen
content: The Indian government has expressed its limitations to prevent the execution of Nimisha Priya, a Keralite nurse sentenced to death in Yemen for the murder of her business partner. On the possibility of blood money, he said, "Blood money is a private negotiation," and stressed that the government could not be asked to act beyond its defined limits.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka high court orders full disclosure of status report
content: The Karnataka High Court has mandated the disclosure of a status report concerning the M Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede, rejecting the state government's request for a sealed cover. The court emphasized that the case does not involve national security or public interest concerns that would justify confidentiality.

title: CM Omar alleges â€˜physical grapplingâ€™ as police stop him from visiting martyrsâ€™ graves
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah faced police obstruction while attempting to pay tribute at Srinagarâ€™s Naqshband Sahib shrine, leading to a physical confrontation and his scaling of a wall to access the site. Authorities had sealed the shrine and placed politicians under house arrest, intensifying the standoff between the elected government and the Centre-appointed administration.

title: 'We will Revoke your US Visa and Deport you if you Do Not ...': US Embassy in India
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a stern warning to visa holders, emphasizing that scrutiny continues even after visa issuance. Authorities continuously monitor compliance with US laws and immigration rules, with potential consequences including visa revocation and deportation for violations.

title: Entire nation eagerly awaits your arrival: Space min to Shux on return journey from ISS
content: India celebrates the successful undocking of the Axiom-4 mission, marking astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's return after 18 days on the ISS. Shukla, the second Indian in space, completed seven ISRO-backed microgravity experiments, paving the way for advancements in space-biotech. The mission, a public-private partnership, signifies India's progress towards space-driven biotech leadership, with the Dragon spacecraft expected to land in California.

title: Stanford row: Marc Andreessen hits out; tells US govt wife was forced out
content: Prominent venture capitalists, including Marc Andreessen and Shaun Maguire, are facing scrutiny for their controversial statements. Andreessen criticized universities and expressed support for Donald Trump, while Maguire made inflammatory remarks about a New York City mayoral candidate, Zohran Mamdani. These incidents highlight a growing ideological divide within the tech industry and raise questions about the responsibilities of influential figures.

title: Government appoints chief justices of 5 high courts, transfers 4 others
content: The Union government has announced the appointment of chief justices for five high courts, including Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Gauhati, Patna, and Jharkhand. Additionally, the chief justices of Rajasthan, Tripura, Jharkhand, and Madras High Courts have been transferred based on the Supreme Court Collegium's recommendations made on May 26.

title: BJP MLAs protest in Jammu over compulsory Urdu for naib tehsildar posts, demand rollback
content: BJP legislators protested in Jammu against a government order mandating Urdu for naib tehsildar recruitment exams. They deemed the order discriminatory towards Jammu's youth and other official languages. MLAs accused the National Conference of creating unrest and denying opportunities to qualified candidates from the Jammu region.

title: AI war: Zuckerberg ups the ante; offers Rs 1,600cr to Apple AI exec; here's who he is
content: Mark Zuckerberg is building Meta's Superintelligence Lab, offering record-breaking salaries up to Rs 1,600 crore to attract top AI talent from Apple, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind. This initiative aims to unify Meta's AI projects and accelerate the development of superintelligence, surpassing AGI. Meta's aggressive recruitment signals an intensified AI talent war in Silicon Valley.

title: Dwyane Wade opens up â€” 'it was rough' co-parenting with Gabrielle â€” reveals family struggles
content: Dwyane Wade discussed the challenges of integrating his children into his relationship with Gabrielle Union, especially considering his public custody battle. Union, who hadn't anticipated being a stepmother, faced a new experience. The couple navigated a difficult period in 2013, including a break during which Wade fathered a child, before ultimately marrying in 2014.

title: Historic governance appointment: NDA ally Gajapathi Raju becomes Goa's new governor
content: In a significant move, former Union Minister and TDP leader Pusapati Ashok Gajapathi Raju has been appointed as the Governor of Goa, marking the first time an NDA ally has secured a gubernatorial position. Kavinder Gupta becomes the Lieutenant Governor of Ladakh, while Ashim Kumar Ghosh is named the new Governor of Haryana.

title: Pant's run-out was the turning point: Shubman on Lord's heartbreak, defends KL Rahul
content: Shubman Gill also clarified the confusion around Pantâ€™s run-out in the first innings, where he was dismissed for 74 while attempting to rotate strike with KL Rahul, who was nearing a century. Asked about his verbal exchange with England opener Zak Crawley on Day 3, Gill played down the moment, saying such things happen in intense contests.

title: CoryxKenshin scandal: Ex accuses YouTuber of abuse, manipulation on TikTok
content: Popular YouTuber CoryxKenshin faces serious allegations from TikTok user @pandaninjaxxofficial, who detailed a harmful relationship involving emotional abuse and manipulation. The accusations include disturbing audio clips and screenshots of messages, sparking outrage online. @pandaninjaxxofficial described feeling emotionally discarded and used, while CoryxKenshin has yet to release an official statement, leaving fans in disbelief and demanding answers.

title: Magic & Cookie Johnson: Stylish vacation wrap-up; family photo ends trip on sweet note
content: Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, recently concluded their European vacation, sharing joyful moments with family and friends on Instagram. The trip included stops in Monaco, Croatia, Portofino, and Cannes, filled with fine dining, attending plays, and yacht retreats. Magic emphasized family time, posting a group photo with his children and grandchildren, highlighting his role as a dedicated family man.

title: Joy Taylor shocked fans â€” Fox Sports fires her mid-show
content: Joy Taylor's departure from Fox Sports, along with the cancellation of 'Speak' featuring Paul Pierce and Keyshawn Johnson, has surprised viewers. The network's decision to end the show, known for its sports debates, has sparked outrage among fans. Industry insiders speculate a shift towards live coverage and digital content may be the reason behind the programming changes.

title: 'Great for settling wars': Trump threatens Russia with tariffs if Ukraine war is not resolved
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened Russia with significant tariffs if a deal to end the war in Ukraine isn't reached within 50 days. Speaking at the White House with Nato Secretary General Mark Rutte, Trump stated he uses trade as a tool for settling conflicts and warned of potential 100 percent tariffs.

title: Tragic! 114-year-old marathon runner Fauja Singh dies in road accident; Punjab Governor reacts
content: The world mourns Fauja Singh, the "Turbaned Tornado", who passed away at 114 in a road accident. He began his marathon journey at 89, becoming the oldest to complete a full marathon at 100. Punjab's Governor remembers him as a symbol of resilience, inspiring millions with his determination and spirit, leaving behind a legacy that transcends records.

title: Where India lost the Lord's Test they should have won
content: England clinched a nail-biting 22-run victory over India at Lord's, seizing a 2-1 lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series. Despite Ravindra Jadeja's resilient 61*, India's batting order crumbled, chasing a target of 193. England's disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer, proved decisive.

title: From dodging a bullet to celebrating Chelsea: A year in Trump's chaotic life
content: A year ago, Donald trumped death, defying the laws of space, time, physics, politics, and logic as he did something that had been done only once before in American history: return to the White House after a hiatus. And not just any break â€” a five-year, scandal-scarred interregnum that included two impeachments, a Capitol riot, multiple indictments, and that gloriously capitalist moment when Trump, now with his own mugshot, began selling it as an NFT and framed it in the White House like it was a Warhol.

title: Tom Brady links with Gretzky â€” enlists Tie Domi cameo â€” turns heads at FIFA Club WC Final
content: NFL icon Tom Brady made a surprise appearance at the FIFA Club World Cup Final, joining forces with NHL legend Wayne Gretzky. Brady also called on longtime friend and former hockey enforcer Tie Domi to round out a star-studded sports trio. Their presence lit up the stadium and created a viral moment that united fans across the NFL, NHL, and soccer worlds.

title: IND vs ENG : 'If that doesn't get you going ...': Stokes powers England to dramatic win
content: Ben Stokes's heroic all-round performance led England to a thrilling 22-run victory over India at Lord's, securing a 2-1 series lead. Stokes's crucial wickets, vital batting contributions, and a game-changing run-out proved decisive. Despite Jadeja's valiant effort, Bashir's final wicket sealed the win for England, setting the stage for an intense battle in Manchester.

title: IND vs ENG: Jadeja's vigil ends in heartbreak for India; England take 2-1 series lead
content: Four down but only 135 to get gave visitors a lot of hope and belief before starting the final day. They had depth in the batting but were unable to close the game they dominated for the majority of the Test. Just like Leeds, Day 5 at Lord's turned out to be a story of what could have been as they ended up on the side they were least expected to.

title: â€˜Very fast paceâ€¦.â€™: Piyush Goyal shares important update on India-US trade deal talks
content: India and the US are accelerating talks to finalize a trade deal before the revised August 1, 2025, tariff deadline. An Indian delegation is in Washington to negotiate the agreement's initial phase. Discussions aim to resolve issues in agriculture and automotive sectors, seeking a mutually beneficial arrangement.

title: IND v ENG: 'You'll know soon' â€“ Gill coy on Bumrah's 4th Test availability
content: Despite a valiant effort from Ravindra Jadeja, India fell short by 22 runs in the Lord's Test, putting England ahead 2-1 in the series. Captain Shubman Gill remained secretive about Jasprit Bumrah's availability for the next match. Gill praised the team's fight but acknowledged the need for better partnerships, expressing optimism for the remaining matches.

title: Kolkata B-school rape: Probe hits wall as 'survivor', her father won't speak; SIT alleges 'zero help'
content: A psychologist's rape allegation against a student at a Kolkata management institute faces hurdles as the complainant and her family refuse to cooperate with the investigation. Despite forensic evidence collection and police efforts to gather information, the family's silence and a lack of engagement with authorities are impeding the probe.

title: IND vs ENG: Once again! India register unwanted record while chasing under 200
content: India suffered a painful 22-run defeat against England at Lord's, failing to chase a target of 193 despite Ravindra Jadeja's valiant 61*. This loss, resulting in a 2-1 series deficit, is statistically rare, as most teams successfully chase similar targets in recent Test history. England's gritty second-innings performance and Jofra Archer's impactful return proved decisive on a challenging pitch.

title: Odisha 'harassment' case: President Murmu meets student who set herself ablaze
content: President Murmu visited a student in the AIIMS Bhubaneswar burn unit who attempted self-immolation after alleging her sexual harassment claims against a professor were ignored. The incident occurred during a protest demanding action against the Head of the Education Department.

title: IND vs ENG: Valiant Jadeja matches Sourav Ganguly's feat at Lord's
content: Ravindra Jadeja displayed resilience at Lord's. He scored a crucial fifty against England. Jadeja's knock kept India in the hunt. He equaled Sourav Ganguly's record. India faced trouble chasing 193. Bumrah supported Jadeja with a crucial partnership. England eventually secured a thrilling win. Jadeja's character stood out despite the loss. His innings almost led India to victory.

title: IND vs ENG: India and England players receive standing ovation in Lordâ€™s Long Room â€“ Watch
content: England clinched a thrilling 22-run victory over India in the third Test at Lord's, taking a 2-1 lead in the five-match series. India, chasing 193, were bowled out for 170 despite Ravindra Jadeja's valiant unbeaten 61. Jofra Archer and Chris Woakes sealed the win for England with their pace attack.

title: 'Avoid trade roadblocks,â€™ says Jaishankar - A hint at Chinaâ€™s mineral curbs?
content: During his visit to China for the SCO conclave, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar urged Beijing to avoid restrictive trade measures, referencing curbs on critical mineral exports. He emphasized normalizing people-to-people exchanges for mutually beneficial cooperation.

title: 'I lost track': Shai Gilgeous-Alexander confession sparks buzz amid birthday celebrations
content: Oklahoma City Thunder's star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is celebrating his 27th birthday. He shared pictures on Instagram. The basketball star is grateful for his wife, Hailey Summers, and family. He acknowledged his wife during his MVP acceptance speech in May 2025. Shai and Hailey married in February 2024. They welcomed their son, Ares, in April 2024. The couple prioritizes their family.

title: 'Only badminton, all our other choices are ... ': Sainaâ€™s old remarks resurface after divorce
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their divorce after seven years of marriage, as revealed in an Instagram post by Saina in July 2025. Despite sharing a passion for badminton, differences in personalities and interests led to their separation. The couple, who married in 2018, emphasized their decision was for 'peace, growth, and healing.'

title: EU climate VP seeks 'fair competition' with China on green energy
content: The European Union is seeking "fair competition" with China and not a race to the bottom in wages and environmental standards, the bloc'in Beijing on Monday. "We Europeans don't want to go down a race towards low incomes, lower labour rights or lower environmental standards," said Ribera, who also serves as the bloc's competition chief.

title: Move away from US: China exports emerge strong despite Trumpâ€™s tariff chaos
content: Despite US tariff pressures, China's exports have shown surprising resilience, achieving a record trade surplus of $586 billion in the first half of the year. While exports to the US declined, Chinese businesses successfully diversified into other markets, particularly ASEAN countries, which saw a 17% increase.

title: As tensions grow at Lord's, Jadeja and Carse locked in heated moment - Watch
content: The India versus England Test match at Lord's saw heated exchanges. Jofra Archer verbally targeted Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes intervened after Brydon Carse confronted Ravindra Jadeja following a collision. India needed 135 runs at the start of Day 5, England six wickets. England dismissed key Indian batsmen. Woakes dismissed Reddy before lunch. The match remained competitive despite England's modest total.

title: Kirk Cousins benched shock; Wife Julieâ€™s 'really sad time' confession on Netflix
content: In Netflix's Quarterback Season 2, Julie Cousins shares the emotional impact of Kirk Cousins being benched for Michael Penix Jr. Despite the difficult news, Kirk displayed remarkable grace by calling Penix to congratulate him. This act of empathy resonated with fans, highlighting the Cousins' resilience and Kirk's exceptional character amidst a challenging transition within the Atlanta Falcons.

title: 'Donâ€™t know if I can invest': Ben Stiller questions Knicks; Summer League take sparks buzz
content: Hollywood star Ben Stiller, a devoted New York Knicks fan, is unhappy. The Knicks lost to the Boston Celtics in the Summer League. Stiller expressed his disappointment on X. He questioned investing in the team. Stiller has been a Knicks fan since childhood. He used to attend games with his father. His tweet has created confusion among the team and its fans.

title: â€˜Citizens must know value of free speechâ€™: SC flags divisive social media content
content: The Supreme Court emphasized the importance of freedom of speech and expression, urging citizens to practice self-regulation to avoid state intervention regarding offensive social media posts. The court is considering guidelines to regulate online content while hearing a case involving Wazahat Khan, who faces multiple FIRs for controversial tweets.

title: Coolest watches we spotted at Wimbledon 2025
content: Wimbledon 2025 witnessed a horological spectacle alongside tennis action, as celebrities showcased extravagant timepieces. David Beckham's custom diamond Tudor and Roger Federer's new Rolex Land-Dweller were highlights. Stars like Molly-Mae Hague and Russell Crowe flaunted Patek Philippe and Rolex respectively, solidifying Wimbledon's status as a luxury showcase.

title: President Murmu visits AIIMS, enquires about Odisha student battling for life
content: Odisha govt. arrests accused teacher and college Principal; directs all colleges to form committees to look into harassment complaints

title: Think tanks need to do a better job to present India in the international context: leading Australian think tank research head
content: Australia and India are closely working on issues in the Indo-Pacific region as well as the ASEAN grouping where the Myanmar crisis has prompted concern from New Delhi and Canberra.

content: Addressing reporters at the BJP state office on Monday, Mr. Surya says the Detailed Project Report and feasibility study for the 18-km tunnel road from Hebbal to Dairy Circle are filled with irregularities

title: Congress struggles to counter P.J. Kurienâ€™s take on Youth Congress leadership
content: Some Cong. leaders feel that Kurien inadvertently played into the SFI-DYFI narrative that the Youth Congress leadership leads an ivory tower existence. K.C. Joseph, V.D. Satheesan back YC, while Chennithala says Kurienâ€™s comments should be taken in the right spirit

title: T.N. Chief Minister set to launch Ungaludan Stalin programme in Chidambaram on July 15
content: Revenue Secretary P. Amudha says 43 services from 13 departments will be offered in urban areas and 46 from 15 departments will be offered in rural areas under the programme

title: Group Captain Shukla has completed all seven microgravity experiments onboard ISS: ISRO
content: Experiments on Indian strain of Tardigrades, Myogenesis, Sprouting of methi and moong seeds, Cyanobacteria, Microalgae, Crop seeds and Voyager Display have been completed as planned, says ISRO

title: Income Tax dept busts major refund fraud in 19 districts of Tamil Nadu
content: The fraudulent refund amount is estimated to be approximately â‚¹500 crore; tax payers were assisted in falsely enhancing their tax deductions enabling them to claim illegitimate refunds

title: BJP raising Congressâ€™ internal matter to divert attention from real issues, alleges Lad
content: Labour minister Santosh Lad has alleged that BJP had been looting the countryâ€™s wealth from the last 11 years and in order to cover up its scams and misrules it was trying to highlight local issues and blowing them up out of proportion.

title: CM launches new ration cards; 80% of Telangana now gets free fine rice
content: Chief Minister says his government is determined to restore the self-respect of the poor through schemes like ration cards, farmersâ€™ insurance and loan waivers; Food and Civil Supplies Minister N. Uttam Kumar Reddy calls the move a â€˜revolution in public service deliveryâ€™

title: People warned against visiting hospitals in Palakkad, Malappuram as Nipah scare escalates
content: Hospitals limit attendants to one person per patient and mandate masks for all staff, patients, and caregivers. The man who succumbed to the disease at Perinthalmanna had mainly travelled on KSRTC buses, which could result in a long contact list

title: India can deliver 70% round-the-clock clean electricity by 2030 at lower cost, says TransitionZero report
content: The report suggests that India can save â‚¹9,000 crore annually by transitioning to round-the-clock clean electricity, which matches consumption with power from zero-carbon sources like solar, wind, and battery storage

title: HC annuls appointment of temporary V-Cs in two universities
content: Division Bench upholds single judgeâ€™s order invalidating appointments of K. Sivaprasad and Ciza Thomas as temporary V-Cs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University and Kerala University of Digital Sciences, Innovation and Technology, respectively

title: MUV safari will resume in Idukki from July 16
content: A multi-department regularisation drive will begin on July 15. Route monitoring committee will inspect the terrain and classify the routes. Only drivers approved by the committee will be allowed to operate and only on the prescribed routes.

content: the current CBA runs through the end of the 2025-26 season . the new CBA is set to begin on sept. 16, 2026 and runs through Sept. 15, 2030 . it would make the fastest both sides have reached an extension in Gary Bettman's tenure .

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .
